0: "Her star will continue to shine bright in our hearts, thoughts and prayers," the actor said in a statement about E'Dena Hines, 33. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR Morgan Freeman's 33-year-old step-granddaughter, E'Dena Hines, died Sunday morning in New York City from stab wounds, according to police. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR Officers responded to a 911 call and found Hines lying down on West 162nd Street in front of her home at around 3 a.m., an NYPD spokesperson told People in a statement. Hines had been stabbed multiple times in her torso, police say. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR Paramedics took Hines to Harlem Hospital, where she was pronounced dead. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR A 30-year-old man at the scene was taken into custody by police, who took him to Columbia Presbyterian Medical Center. Police are continuing to investigate. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR In a statement released to The Hollywood Reporter, Freeman said about Hines: "The world will never know her artistry and talent, and how much she had to offer. Her friends and family were fortunate enough to have known what she meant as a person. Her star will continue to shine bright in our hearts, thoughts and prayers. May she rest in peace."
